intro: Herpestis cochlearia, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
